Reviews.Title: Kodak lives up to its legacy in the digital realm
Reviews.Author: N. C. Weber
Reviews.Content: I am thoroughly impressed with the Kodak Z760 digital camera.  Not only does it take superb hi-res digital pictures, but controls are easy to use.  Most functions are written out in plain English rather than cryptic abbreviations or hieroglyphic icons.  The flexibility to use either preset camera settings for any occasion, or to customize your own if you are a photo pro is another big plus that makes this camera appealing to a wide range of photo enthusiasts.The Kodak EasyShare software that comes with the camera is a bit clunky and overbearing, but it's easy to use and it tracks when you took your pictures and where you downloaded them with relative ease.All in all, this is a great camera to have.  Compact size, simple to use, and a decent sized screen to read clear font text instructions.

Reviews.Title: great kodak colors!
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: this is a solid point and shoot camera.  easy to use, it produces pictures with rich, vibrant tones kodak is famous for.  there is also a printer dock that recharges the batteries (no need to remove the battery--just put the camera on top of the dock).  the dock also prints at the touch of a button.  no computer is necessary, but if you hook the dock to one, you can even send e-mails!  the prints have a clear coat so they don't run or smudge, like some ink jets prints do.anyhow, a great camera at a great price.

Reviews.Title: The best (top of the line!) camera I have ever had!!
Reviews.Author: T. Munday "Tracy"
Reviews.Content: This camera is very nice. It is so easy to use. And the pictures are wondeful! Kodak really made an awesome camera! The camera, dock (not printer dock), and the kodak software are very nice and easy to use. Great cameral for any and all events!

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC!!!!
Reviews.Author: Dana Carley
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy, takes GREAT pictures, and is an all around great digital camera.  If I had to state any drawbacks, it would be that the flash range makes it difficult for indoor long shots (kids concerts, kids indoor sports etc).  But, other smaller compact digitals have the same problem, so unless you want to get a camera with a detatchable flash (and lenses) this a great choice. The lithium rechargagle battery lasts a lot longer than other rechargables. I absolutely LOVE this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a great price!
Reviews.Author: Colomama
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about this camera! It is easy to use and takes excellent pictures. There are lots of settings for different conditions, such as: sports, secenery, close up, and night. There is also a black and white setting for those classic looking b&w; photos. The video works better than I expected, but there must be plenty of light. I love the dock that recharges the battery and transfers the pictures to a computer with the push of a button. 5 stars out of 5- I highly reccomend this camera to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Unmatched for under $200
Reviews.Author: wells05 "wells05"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera after returning a Samsung Digimax A7 (poor color) for $199 incudling dock.The Good:  Very happy with the picture quality.  Excellent features and very esy to use.  The dock is very convenient - charging the battery and transfering pics.The Bad:  Unattached lens cap, not the most aesthetically pleasing camera out there.For me the picture quality and ease of use is what counts, and I really couldn't be happier. especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Victor Newman
Reviews.Content: This is my first digital camera and I'm very pleased.  It is easy to use and the pictures have turned out very well--clear and crisp.  This camera not only takes nice photos but decent videos as well (provided there is enough light--I wouldn't substitute this for a video cam).I did some research on the digital cameras...given the price and quality, this is a good choice.The "User's Guide" isn't the greatest...some things aren't well explained (like using the self-timer) but I was able to find the information I needed on the Kodak website.The pictures and videos are easy to download and burn to CDs.  I love this camera and would purchase it all over again.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA AT A GREAT PRICE!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Gregory J. Burton
Reviews.Content: I was never one for taking pictures.  I decided on a digital camera to take before, and after pictures of my home which I purchased in March of 2005.  This camera is so easy to use.  It is fun to use.  I even bought a photo album to keep the pictures in showing the progress I'm making at remodeling my house. I bought my mother a Kodak Easyshare camera with the printer dock, as she doesn't have a computer, or printer.  She loves taking pictures.  I know she'll appreciate the ease of use.  I'm anxious to hear her reaction!  I love my camera, and I'm sure she'll enjoy using hers.  It's nice to know that you don't have to spend a lot of money for a quality camera.  Way to go Kodak!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera...
Reviews.Author: Eric Schultz "Education Major"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for $164 total. It is so great. The picture quality is good and the digital zoom hasn't really done too much damage to the quality of the pictures. I would've liked to have had more than 32 mb of internal memory (just around 25-30 pics @ 6 mp). It is still a great camera. The screen is nice and big and is very clear to see your pictures. I love having the movie mode also. The various settings are also great. It's a great camera overall. I would highly reccomend to the most advanced and most amateur of photographers.

Reviews.Title: PERFECT.
Reviews.Author: Lo.
Reviews.Content: I am a teenager who loves to take pictures.  I love photography and just casual pictures with friends.  This camera was a christmas present last year and has surpassed my expectations.  I can take amazing pictures to wow everyone with.  The multiple settings make it easy to capture every sort of pictures.  I have the 256mb memory card.  On the highest setting I can take atleast 180 pictures.  The lcd screen is quite large.  I love being the envy of all of my friends with this masterpiece.  The only negative thing I can say about this camera is the fact that its a bit bulky for carrying to school and everything.

Reviews.Title: GOOD, BUT NOT EASY.
Reviews.Author: Vanessa M. Henderson
Reviews.Content: I have had my Kodak Z760 for a few months now and even though it is a great camera, it's not as easy to use as it might seem to be.  You have to know a litte about photography to really get great results from it.  I have a Nikon 3100 and I found it to be a lot easier to use.  You do have a thousand options to work with the Z760, but it does require some basic knowledge about photography.  It's not a "beginner" camera.One of the things I love about this camera is the battery life.  I love my Nikon but I hate its batteries life.  The Kodak Z760 battery life is just wonderful.  You don't have to recharge it every time you take pictures using the flash.The picture quality is great.  Overall, it's a great camera.  You only have to dedicate a little bit of your time to really learn how it works; and perfect everything the camera has to offer you.

Reviews.Title: The Perfect Camera For Blogging, Baby!
Reviews.Author: Livin' La Vida Low-Carb Man "Jimmy Moore"
Reviews.Content: As a blogger, I was looking for a quality digital camera that would give me the versatility to take pictures of whatever whenever I needed to illustrate points at my blog.  The Kodak Z760 Easyshare Digital Camera does the trick!I've been a BIG FAN of photography since I was a kid, but never have I enjoyed the flexibility of taking pictures like I have with this one.  The old school way of picture-taking included many wasted dollars on pictures that didn't quite turn out.  With this camera, if you get back picture, just delete it and try again.  INSTANT GRATIFICATION!Plus, you can download the photos to your computer and clean them up easily before printing them out.  In my estimation, you couldn't ask for a better camera than this one.  I've had it over a year and would not even think about using another camera for family photos and memories.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: A Great Camera for Traveling
Reviews.Author: D. Dimas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to buy a digital camera for a trip to China. Using the Z760 and two 1.0 GB memeory cards we were able to take hundreds of great pictures and some QVGA videos. Although I bought extra batteries for it we never ran out of power.I use Linux so I was pleased to note that this camera is compatible with my OS and does not need the software on the CD. For photo editing the GIMP does a fine job.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Z760 The Bomb!!!
Reviews.Author: Eileen P. Smith "Nicholas Smith"
Reviews.Content: My brother in law was getting rid of this camera at christmas and I told him I wanted it. I am sooo happy I did. It takes the best pictures, even in low light, the hardest to capture pictures. I have another Kodak, but this one takes the cake. The best colors, and great all around camera.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what we were looking for
Reviews.Author: lorin m
Reviews.Content: We LOVE this camera so far!  We've had it for about a week--it replaces our old dead camera and so far it's perfect.  My fiance uses it for point-and-shoot, and he's explored the functions a little (see our submitted photo of the aquarium), and I use all the manual settings and functions.  I love that it has a rechargable battery... we used to spend so much money on AAs for our old camera!  The screen is nice and big and so are the photos... who needs more than 3x optical zoom?!  Our prerequisites for buying a new camera were that it had to have a large screen, large photo size (MPs), and video with audio, and our Z760 has all of that.  We also got a refurbished one, so the price was right too!

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Sarah Adams "carol peterson"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! I got this camera for Christmas and it is lightweight and  compact. It is soooo much smaller than I thought it would be. It is so easy to use!

Reviews.Title: Sure wish a modern camera was as good as the Z760.
Reviews.Author: Guiseppe76
Reviews.Content: I've had the Kodak Z760 for over 5 years.  It's been a great camera and I only got a replacement for it because I wanted to be able to shoot HD video and take wide-angle shots.  It wasn't until I got my new camera that I really began to understand how well the Z760 performs.  My new camera is a Panasonic Lumix ZS7 which on paper is supposed to be far superior to my old Kodak.  This is not the case.  The Kodak has an uncanny ability to shoot high-speed objects in perfect focus, especially in auto-mode.  As an example, this past winter (Feb/2011) I turned and took a picture while running down a snowy hill.  The shot was a picture of my 2 year old son and his little buddy flying down the hill on a sled, and someone running full speed behind them.  You can take this camera and spin around in a room... press the shutter button and it will snap a perfectly focused picture of whatever it was pointing at in that exact moment.  I can't for the life of me get a modern camera to shoot that well in auto mode, let alone messing with shutter speed and ISO.  Even my brother's high-end $600 camera can't do this.  From what I hear, even the new Kodak easyshare cameras can't do it either.  The Z760 was a special camera indeed.It does not do indoor low-light pictures too well, but it's amazing outside and anywhere there is decent light.  It's total crap at a concert, as I've tried using it at several different ones and it did not get great results.  The macro on it is awesome and is one of the features I used most often.  Luckily I didn't sell mine yet, since I will probably be selling my Panasonic and trying to get something that will perform as well as the Z760 but with higher megapixels, zoom and HD video.  My plan is to take a secure digital memory card into Walmart or any other store that lets you check out the cameras and try shooting a few pictures with several different cameras while shaking/waving the camera, among other test shots to determine my next camera purchase.  That way I can take the card home and see how the pics turn out when on a larger monitor for comparison.  The Panasonic Lumix just doesn't take the quality pictures that it's reviews stated it does, and nearly every single action shot is blurred.  This is not good since my 2 year old is rarely still.  Too bad this camera is so outdated.  This review is more of a eulogy to a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera
Reviews.Author: Misty Lynn Lackey "Shade of the Moon Cross"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in 2006 brand new at walmart paid 280.00 in all for it with the dock it has been a great adventure for me the photos with this camera is great I also use Paintshop Pro to add a flare to my pics but a lot of people thinks I do good with pics and it's because of this camera the only bad side is you can't take photos of birds with this camera but it's still wonderful and well worth buying at the current price now I see please buy this you will be very pleased... even if this camera was till 280 I would pay this it's outstanding!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Not worth the repair
Reviews.Author: Joe Consumer
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this camera for about 13 months, and it was very user friendly.  Two cons:  It does not take very good quality pictures in low light situations and the mode dial ceased working altogether.  The camera will not even turn on now.  Estimated cost of replacing the mode dial is $125 which is 60% of the initial cost of the camera and more than a new purchase of a Z760 today.  Because of the cost of repairs, I will not be buying another Kodak to replace my relatively new camera.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: JO "IUSB Grad"
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera.  It is very easy to use and it takes nice clear pictures.

Reviews.Title: a nice camera
Reviews.Author: michael
Reviews.Content: it a very nice camera,. takes great pictures. I got it for my sister for Christmas. and she loves it

Reviews.Title: SMILE! You're on FB!
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: Love my camera. Easy to snap and easy to load and share pictures. Thus the name, Kodak Easyshare. Perfect name for the perfect camera.

Reviews.Title: What I expected
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L. Duff "Zvanoizu"
Reviews.Content: This was a replacement for  a Z760 that I already owned. A fantastic product abd perfect for my purposes. Looking forward to many years of reliable service and excellent quality photos.

Reviews.Title: Perfect camera choice for me
Reviews.Author: Linda Sulzdorf
Reviews.Content: I wanted a back-up camera for my trip to Grenada, and since I already owned an older easy-share camera, purchasing a used newer model seemed like a smart move, as i didn't want to risk losing a new expensive camera in the Caribbean.  Except for two times when the shutter didn't open, the camera worked well....i did not take any videos so cannot evaluate their quality.  The battery life was acceptable and the picture quality was good.

Reviews.Title: Z760 Camera
Reviews.Author: Lowell Wylie
Reviews.Content: I have used my camera for work purposes for years because of the date stamp feature and the good quality pictures. I had to purchase this one because the battery door broke on my original camera. I just hope this one will last as long as the original.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera, I miss it
Reviews.Author: nicole
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for 5 yrs before I sold it on amazon.  Even though I got a really good price on it, I didn't really want to sell it because it was such an awesome camera.  I loved the dock and never had to really worry about charging.  I wish new cameras still had the view finder.  It was a very sturdy camera.  I had it for 5 yrs and never had any problems with it.  I hope my new camera can measure up.

Reviews.Title: Where do I begin..
Reviews.Author: GeoMiP
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a birthday gift about 6 years ago as a Christmas gift and just reached it's last straw yesterday. First off, the camera is durable. It has been thrown, dropped, kept in extreme heat and still didn't fail me. I've taken thousands of pictures with it, some of them pretty good. Here's some examples: [...]It's been an amazing camera, and odds are would have lasted a few more years if I had taken better care of it. 5 stars

Reviews.Title: The perfect camera for me!
Reviews.Author: DES
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! This is my second Z760; I bought it as a back up just in case something happened to my original.  Now I'm using both.  I shoot a lot of outdoor pictures, mostly wildlife, and the 3x zoom is ideal in shaded areas where I take most pictures. Anything more would require more light & set off the flash, which would scare wildlife.  It has a viewfinder which is also necessary when shooting wildlife. Many of the newer cameras no longer have viewfinders. Kodak Easy Share Cameras are very user friendly....it has many diffrent settings, plus video capability yet is very easy to use.  I use the dock to recharge the battery & to download pictures to my computer (piece of cake). I was lucky to get a hard case with both my Z760's which is good protection for the camera. The camera (in it's case) is small enough to carry in my purse or in a coat pocket but it is not too dainty to hold firmly. I've had my original Z760 for several years & I'm still using the original battery. I set it on the dock & recharge it daily.  Best of all....it takes GREAT pictures!  You can view the User's Guide & other info by going to [..]

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT EVEN AFTER FIVE YEARS
Reviews.Author: shanweis
Reviews.Content: I have had my Kodak z760 for 4 years and have since bought a newer Canon compact camera. The Kodak takes better pictures in all situations except low light. I have taken several pictures in which many people comment and wonder if they were taken by a professional photographer. I have three 8 by 10s hanging on my wall along with some professional studio portraits. People cannot tell the difference and a couple have actually indicated the pictures taken with the Kodak look better! I now carry the Kodak around in my purse and have thought about using it even more than the Canon--which often times produces grainy images.I LOVE THE KODAK Z760!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Kodak EasyShare Z760 camera
Reviews.Author: Tara
Reviews.Content: This little camera takes wonderful pictures. The video does really great too, but once you start recording you can't zoom.

Reviews.Title: very good camera
Reviews.Author: gomez bernardo
Reviews.Content: i had the z760 for almost a year, it is a sturdy camera, a little big but still confortable to hold, it has an array of options that let you get creative with your pictures.it has all the functions it ought have and lets face it 6.1MP are more that enough for non-pro picture taking.i was very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Camera,
Reviews.Author: S. Duarte
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a little over 200.00 dollars.! The first days I hated It, because I didnt like the results of the pictures, but as I played around with it, I LOVED IT, now I  have upgraded to an 8.MP digital camera, but still this is a great camera and I loved the beautiful picttures it took! VERY GOOD CAMERA

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Polly A. Randash
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  We have had this camera for two years now and it works just as good as the day we got it.  And actually we bought it refurbished at an excellent price, boy am I glad that we did.  We have three kids and this camera has never let us down.  This is our second Kodak digital camera and between the cameras and the software we won't buy another brand it will always be kodak.  The quality of the pictures is excellent and I love ordering them online and having them shipped to my house.  Such a great convenience.

Reviews.Title: Still a really decent camera even in 2008
Reviews.Author: Joseph L. Kashi
Reviews.Content: Even compared to late 2007-early 2008 compact models, this camera does really well at low ISO.  The lens is very sharp and bright light photos can be readily enlarged to 13x19 and 18x24 with proper sharpening and noise-reduction technique (I use the Noiseware plug-in for CS3).  Even though I have newer, more expensive cameras, I still keep a z760 in the office and one at home.  It remains an excellent travel camera, particularly in bright sunlight situations.

Reviews.Title: Nice Features, Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Elijah Neeley
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about 4-5 months now, and I am very impressed with it. Its easy enough to use Auto when taking pictures with/of friends and family, and has the manual modes for photographers.While it doesn't have all the features of a SLR camera, it  is also hundreds less, and takes very nice pictures. The colors are wonderful. Mine came with the base to hook up to your computer/charge the camera, and it makes it that much easier to get the pictures on the computer.The camera is perfect for those of you who want crisp, clear pictures of family and friends, and for beginner photographers who can't afford a SLR camera.-Edit- After about a year of taking pictures, many without flash, the flash has gone out on it. It could have just been my camera, but be careful. I still use it a lot, because I didn't use the flash much anyway, but it does get annoying not having it.

Reviews.Title: I now own 2 digital cameras. (no thanks)
Reviews.Author: Kennen Haas "Kennen"
Reviews.Content: Three problems:1)NiCd battery holds a insufficient charge, lasting for only a few minuets.2) Auto focus provides infocus pictures about 50% of the time with no ability to use a manual focus.3) It has completely died.Two silver linings:1)The customer service people are as helpful as they can be and rapaired the focusing problem for the cost of shipping. Upon return they gave me a free photo printer.2) For the short time that it did work (kinda) the camera had an abundance of features.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, broke after 3 uses
Reviews.Author: Paul J. Feeney Jr. "doing my best"
Reviews.Content: Maybe I received a bad apple, I enjoyed it the few times I used it, but the second time off the docking station the image is just a color show...  I dont know if I should stick with this one

ProductInfo.Features:
6.1-megapixel CCD captures enough detail for photo-quality 14 x 19-inch prints
Features all-glass Schneider-Kreuznach Variogon 3x optical zoom and 4x digital zoom
High-speed, low-light, autofocus system gives you the best possible shots under a variety of situations
Captures up to 80 minutes of continuous video with audio, or 5-, 15-, or 30-second clips
Manual shutter speed ranges from 64 seconds to 1/1000 seconds
ProductInfo.Name: Kodak Easyshare Z760 6.1 MP Digital Camera with 3xOptical Zoom
